Quick Facts

EXIT   X

DUTIES OF PCBUs

Page

Table of Contents

 

 

Click the buttons below for more information

 

 

 

Emergency plans

As a PCBU you have a duty to prepare, maintain and implement an emergency plan for each workplace. This must:

 

•

outline procedures to be followed in the event of an emergency. This includes evacuation plans, medical treatment and assistance options, various means of notifying emergency services and ways of providing effective communication to workers during an emergency

•

involve regular testing of emergency procedures, for example, fire drills

•

provide information, training and instruction to relevant workers about how to carry out the planned emergency procedures

 

First aid

You must ensure that:

 

•

first-aid equipment is provided for the workplace

•

workers have access to the equipment

•

there are facilities for administering first aid at the workplace

•

an adequate number of workers are trained in administering first aid

•

workers have access to people trained in first aid

 

The level of first aid equipment and the number of staff trained in first aid depends on certain characteristics of the workplace, including the:

 

•

nature of work performed at the workplace

•

nature of the hazards at the workplace

•

size and location of the workplace

•

number and composition of workers at the workplace
